importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the news of Doug Martin's death was reported by the Associated Press, indicating the timeline of the incident and public reaction.
The date when Doug Martin was drafted by the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in the first round of the NFL draft, a key milestone in his professional career.
The year in which Martin had a standout rushing season (1,402 yards, 6 touchdowns), earning him first-team All-Pro and Pro Bowl honors.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe during which Martin was taken into custody and died, specifically early Saturday morning in October 2025, indicating the urgency and immediacy of the incident.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former NFL running back and All-Pro player, died after a brief struggle with police while being detained for a suspected break-in at a home in Oakland.
Martin was the 31st overall pick in the 2012 NFL draft and played six seasons with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and one with the Oakland Raiders.
He accumulated 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns over his career, and was named first-team All-Pro in 2015.
Martin was selected as one of the top 50 players in Tampa Bay Buccaneers history, highlighting his legacy and impact on the franchise.
The Oakland Police Department reported a 'brief struggle' during the arrest; no further details were released, raising concerns about police conduct and accountability.
The Alameda County Coroner's Office confirmed the death, but the cause of death remains under investigation with an autopsy pending.
Martin’s family requested privacy during the grieving process, and city officials, including Mayor Barbara Lee, expressed condolences and acknowledged his significance as an Oaklander.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, a standout player for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and one of the franchise's top 50 players, died after a brief struggle with Oakland police during a detention related to a suspected home break-in. The incident occurred early Saturday in October 2025, and Martin was transported to a hospital where he died at 36; the cause of death has not been released, and an autopsy is underway. The Oakland Police Department reported a 'brief struggle' during the arrest, with no further details provided. Martin was drafted 31st overall in 2012 and had a career marked by 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns. His family requested privacy, and Oakland Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences, highlighting Martin's status as a local hero and respected community figure.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Struggle with Police During Arrest for Break-In in Oakland
